message.content: A metonymy (also spelled metonymy or metonym) is a figure of speech in which a word or phrase is substituted for another with which it is closely associated, such that the substitution conveys a broader meaning than any single word could convey. It is commonly used to refer to a thing or concept by naming something closely related to it, often as an abbreviation or shorthand. For example, referring to "The White House" to mean the President of United States or using "Hollywood" to represent the film industry in general.
